alternative_parents.description: Monosaccharides in which the sugar unit is a is a six-carbon containing moeity.
alternative_parents.name: Hexoses

alternative_parents.description: Hydroxy acids with a 6 to 12 carbon atoms long side chain.
alternative_parents.name: Medium-chain hydroxy acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Fatty acids with an aliphatic tail that contains between 4 and 12 carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Medium-chain fatty acids

alternative_parents.description: Fatty acids in which the chain bears a hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Hydroxy fatty acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid substituted with a hydroxyl group on the C3 carbon atom.
alternative_parents.name: Beta hydroxy acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aldehyde substituted with a hydroxy group on the second carbon atom.
alternative_parents.name: Beta-hydroxy aldehydes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carboxylic acid substituted with a hydroxyl group on the adjacent carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha hydroxy acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aldehyde substituted with a hydroxyl group on the adjacent carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha-hydroxyaldehydes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing more than one hydroxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Polyols

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
class.name: Organooxygen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as glucuronic acid derivatives. These are compounds containing a glucuronic acid moiety (or a derivative), which consists of a glucose moiety with the C6 carbon oxidized to a carboxylic acid.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing a glucuronic acid moiety (or a derivative), which consists of a glucose moiety with the C6 carbon oxidized to a carboxylic acid.
direct_parent.name: Glucuronic acid derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Compounds containing a saccharide unit which bears a carboxylic acid group.
intermediate_nodes.name: Sugar acids and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Monosaccharides, disaccharides, oligosaccharides, polysaccharides, and their derivatives.
subclass.name: Carbohydrates and carbohydrate conjugates

superclass.description: Organic compounds that contain one or more oxygen atoms.
superclass.name: Organic oxygen compounds
